ground_truth: The length of the hypotenuse of an isosceles right triangle is $\sqrt{2}$ times the length of each leg.  Therefore, $BD=\frac{BC}{\sqrt{2}}=\frac{2}{\sqrt{2}}\cdot\left(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{\sqrt{2}}\right)=\frac{2\sqrt{2}}{2}=\sqrt{2}$ units.  Applying the same rule to triangle $ABD$, we find that $AB=BD/\sqrt{2}=\sqrt{2}/\sqrt{2}=1$ unit.  The perimeter of quadrilateral $ABCD$ is $AB+BD+CD+DA=1+2+\sqrt{2}+1=\boxed{4+\sqrt{2}}$ units.
